result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Max D. Rivera

records.addlTxt:
Cases 22CF131, 22TR1432, 22TR1433, 22TR1434, & 22TR1435 called @ 9:12 AM: Attorney Morgan Rae in court for Max D. Rivera. Attorney Matthew R. Leusink in court for State of Wisconsin. Statement by DA Leusink, offers have been exchanged. Atty Rae advises a resolution is likely, requests another STC. Statement by the Court. STC scheduled - NOH given.
Status conference scheduled for December 7, 2022 at 01:55 pm.
Status conference on December 7, 2022 at 01:55 pm.

Case called @ 2:35 PM Defendant Max D. Rivera in court.  Attorney Morgan Rae in court for Max D. Rivera.  Attorney Matthew R. Leusink in court for State of Wisconsin. Offer has been sent to Atty Rae. Atty Rae is requesting additional time to review the offer with her client.
Status conference scheduled for October 25, 2022 at 09:10 am.
Status conference on October 25, 2022 at 09:10 am.

Case called @ 10:20 AM Defendant Max D. Rivera in court.  Attorney Dennis J Ryan in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Morgan Rae in court for Max D. Rivera. Sergeant Scott Eagan sworn in for testimony. Direct examination by ADA Ryan. Witness identifies the Defendant in the courtroom. Cross examination by Atty Rae. The Court finds probable cause does exist. Defendant BOT. Information filed. Receipt admitted - Reading waived. NG Plea entered. STC scheduled - NOH given.
Status conference scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Status conference on September 19, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Order for Reassignment of Cases from Judge Dutcher to Judge Blader signed by Chief Judge Dutcher on 8/1/2022 filed in 2022GF27.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt:
Case called @ 1:20 PM Defendant Max D. Rivera in court.  Attorney Dennis J Ryan in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Morgan Rae in court for Max D. Rivera. Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and potential punishment.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived. Court entertains waiver of the time limits for the preliminary hearing. Court accepts voluntary waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing. NGP entered. STC Scheduled - NOH Given. Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 3, 2022 at 10:15 am.
Preliminary hearing on August 3, 2022 at 10:15 am.
No operation of any motor vehicles whatsoever.

Case called @ 12:12 PM Defendant Max D. Rivera appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Wesley Kottke in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Morgan Rae appeared by video for Max D. Rivera. Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and potential punishment.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel. Defendant is eligible for SPD services. Bond argument by ADA Kottke. Bond argument by Atty Rae. Court orders: $1000 cash bond. IA Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.
Initial appearance scheduled for June 21, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Initial appearance on June 21, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
